xxl.core.pipes.scheduler
Class StrategyScheduler

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      xxl.core.pipes.scheduler.StrategyScheduler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable, Scheduler
public class StrategyScheduler
extends Thread
implements Scheduler

A implementation of Scheduler using a Strategy.

Since:
1.1

 int getMaxSchedulingPriority()
          Returns the maximum value for priorities supported by this scheduler.
 int getMinSchedulingPriority()
          Returns the minimum value for priorities supported by this scheduler As this scheduler does not use priorites, Integer.MIN_VALUE is returned.

          Returns the normal value for priorities supported by this scheduler As this scheduler does not use priorities, 0 is returned.

getMaxSchedulingPriority

public int getMaxSchedulingPriority()
Returns the maximum value for priorities supported by this scheduler. As this scheduler does not use priorites, Integer.MAX_VALUE is returned.

Specified by:

Returns:
the maximum value for priorities supported by this scheduler

schedule

public void schedule(SchedulableProcessor proc)
              throws IllegalArgumentException
When a SchedulableProcessors setScheduler-Method is called it will call this method to register itself to this scheduler.

Specified by:
schedule in interface Scheduler
Parameters:
proc - the SchedulableProcessor to be scheduled
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if proc does not implement StrategyInput
See Also:
Processor.setScheduler(Scheduler)

Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if proc does not implement StrategyInput

scheduleAfter

public void scheduleAfter(SchedulableProcessor proc,
                          SchedulableProcessor predecessor)
As the order of processors is determined by the strategy, this method only throws an UnsupportedOperationException.

Specified by:
scheduleAfter in interface Scheduler
Parameters:
proc - the Processor to be scheduled
predecessor - the predecessing Processor
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - always
